adjective.meaning: Able to move or be moved freely or easily.
adjective.example: ‘he has a weight problem and is not very mobile’
‘he has a weight problem and is not very mobile’
‘he has a weight problem and is not very mobile’
‘he has a weight problem and is not very mobile’

adjective.meaning: Relating to mobile phones, handheld computers, and similar technology.
adjective.example: ‘the next generation of mobile networks’

adjective.meaning: Able or willing to move easily or freely between occupations, places of residence, or social classes.

noun.meaning: A decorative structure that is suspended so as to turn freely in the air.
noun.example: ‘brightly coloured mobiles rotated from the ceiling’
‘we telephoned from our mobile to theirs’

noun.meaning: The Internet as accessed via smartphones or other mobile devices, especially when regarded as a market sector.
noun.example: ‘the biggest growth area in games right now is in mobile’

proper noun.meaning: An industrial city and port on the coast of southern Alabama; population 191,022 (est. 2008).
